Dear Ms. Sears:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Unusual incident reporting policy
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12415
Section • (1) An agency must adhere to the following incident
Description reporting protocols:
• (a) Immediately notify the child's parents; the
department licensing authority; the lawyer guardian
ad litem and court, as applicable; the department;
and the foster child's parents, if any of the following
occurs:
(ii) The foster child is absent without legal permission.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency failed to notify all relevant parties
upon youth's AWOL.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 11/13/24.
Complainant reported the agency failed to report timely the AWOL
of a youth, (Youth A), who had truanted an agency independent
living program late in the evening of 10/23/24. Complainant
reported the agency did not report the youth being AWOL until
10/25/24. Complainant reported the Court received a DHS-3198
Unauthorized Leave Report to Court/Law Enforcement on
10/25/24 notifying the Court of the AWOL of Youth A. Complainant
reported that an emergency hearing was then scheduled for late in
the day of 10/25/24. The Complainant reported the Court should
have been notified promptly of the AWOL.
The agency Chief Administrator was notified of the complaint
on 11/20/24 via telephone. The Chief Administrator provided
agency worker contact information as well as documents for
review.
The Director of Foster Care was interviewed via telephone on
01/03/25. The Director of Foster Care, hereafter referred to as
2

“Director”, reported the agency had notified all relevant parties but
remarked that time frame notifications may have been slow. The
Director reported that upon Youth A’s AWOL on 10/23/24 at 11:38
pm the DHHS Monitor and Guardian Ad Litem, (GAL), were
notified of the AWOL the next day, 10/24/24, at 11:00 AM by the
agency worker, Staff 1. The Director reported the Court received
notification through the DHS-3198 on 10/25/24. The Director
reported that Youth A’s Grandmother was notified on 10/25/24.
Staff 1, agency foster care worker assigned to the case, was
interviewed on 01/08/25. Staff 1 reported the DHHS-Monitor and
GAL were notified of Youth A’s AWOL via email on 10/24/24, at
10:48 AM. Staff 1 reported that Youth A’s Grandmother, who is his
guardian, was informed of his AWOL on 10/25/24. Staff 1 reported
that the DHS-3198 form was filed with the Court on 10/25/24.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
• Agency Timeline of Events: This timeline, received from
the Chief Administrator, documents in part, that Youth A
went AWOL on 10/23/24 at 11:38pm and the GAL and
DHHS Monitor were notified by 11:00 am on 10/24/24. The
Court was notified via the DHS-3198-A at 3:38 PM on
10/25/24.
• Email: An email, dated 10/24/24, at 10:48 AM was sent
from Staff 1 to the GAL and the DHHS Monitor notifying
them of Youth A’s AWOL.
• DHS-3198-A Unauthorized Leave Report to Court/Law
Enforcement. The form, dated 10/25/24, signed by Staff 1
and submitted to the Court on 10/25/24 was reviewed.
• Incident Report: A Methodist Family Services Incident
Report dated 10/23/24 was reviewed and documents Youth
A’s AWOL on 10/23/24.
• MCHS Policy: Policy number C.14, titled “AWOL/Bed
Hold” was reviewed. The policy states in part, “The Case
Manager will notify the DHHS worker within one hour of the
AWOLP occurring”, and “The Case Manager will notify the
Court of jurisdiction and the parents if appropriate within 24
hours of the youth being AWOLP and document those
contacts in the case file.”
Analysis There was a delayed notification to the DHHS Monitor and GAL by
approximately 11 hours. The AWOL occurred on 10/23/24 at
11:44 PM and notification to those parties did not occur until
10/24/24 at 10:48am.
3

Staff 1 reported that she did not notify Youth A’s Grandmother
until 10/25/24.
The Complainant reported that the Court was not notified of Youth
A’s AWOL until 10/25/24.
The Division of Child Welfare Licensing was not notified of Youth
A’s AWOL.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
